frame.name: Fullness
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Container</fen> is in a state of fullness/emptiness with respect to some <fen>Contents</fen>. Note the connection between words in this frame and those in the Containers, Emptying, and Filling frames. <ex>John carried <fex name="Container">a bucket</fex> <t>full</t> <fex name="Contents">of water</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Container</fen> is used for the entity whose fullness is being described. <ex>John carried an <t>empty</t> <fex name="Container">bucket</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Contents
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Contents</fen> is used for the stuff that is present/absent in the <fen>Container</fen>. <ex>The bucket is <t>full</t> <fex name="Contents">of water</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the amount of <fen>Contents</fen> in the <fen>Container</fen> diverges from the maximal expected amount for the <fen>Container</fen>.
<ex>Be careful, because the glass is <fex name="deg">very</fex> <t>full</t> .</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of times the <fen>Container</fen> is empty per unit of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Duration</fen> denotes the length of time from the beginning of the <fen>Container</fen>'s fullness to the end. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: empty.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: containing nothing; not filled or occupied.

lexUnit.name: emptiness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of containing nothing

lexUnit.name: fullness.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of being full.
